title: Joey (TV series)
summary: Joey is an American sitcom created by Scott Silveri and Shana Goldberg-Meehan and a spin-off/sequel to Friends starring Matt LeBlanc reprising his role as Joey Tribbiani. It premiered on NBC on September 9, 2004, in the former time slot of its parent series Thursday nights at 8:00 p.m. Midway through the second season, the show was placed on a hiatus by NBC but returned on March 7, 2006, in a new timeslot of Tuesdays at 8:30 p.m. Only one episode, "Joey and the Snowball Fight," was shown in this new timeslot before the show was pulled by NBC when it was overshadowed in ratings by American Idol. NBC canceled the series due to poor ratings on August 23, 2006.
